faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €369,900. This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment represents premium specification at just €3,626/m²—40% below comparable Spanish island markets. Payment options include cash, EU mortgages, and structured purchasing arrangements through established conveyancing firms.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign nationals have identical property purchase rights as Spanish citizens, with no restrictions on property ownership. EU citizens benefit from reciprocal rights, while non-EU nationals require only NIE tax identification numbers. UK citizens post-Brexit maintain unchanged purchase rights through established legal frameworks.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-10% of property price, including: transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5%), and registry costs (0.5%). No stamp duty applies. Legal representation (solicitor/abogado) costs approximately €1,000-€1,500. For this €369,900 property, expect total acquisition costs of €30,000-€37,000.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value, typically €200-€400 annually for properties like this apartment. Non-resident rental properties pay 19% corporate income tax on net rental profits after deductions. These predictable tax structures enable accurate investment return calculations.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish and European banks offer mortgages to foreign nationals, typically 60-70% loan-to-value for purchase properties. Interest rates currently range 3-4.5% with 20-30 year terms. EU citizens benefit from identical terms as Spanish residents; non-EU nationals should expect slightly enhanced due diligence but maintain full access to mortgage financing.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Torre Pacheco is 30-40% lower than UK equivalents: groceries €30-50 weekly, dining €12-20 per person, utilities €80-120 monthly. Healthcare and education are exceptionally cost-effective compared to Anglo-Saxon countries. This affordability extends property investment returns significantly.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca represents a strategically strong property market with verified 6-8% annual appreciation, established international demand, and mature infrastructure. However, value concentration has shifted toward secondary markets like Torre Pacheco. Properties in recognized hotspots (Benidorm, Torrevieja) command premium pricing; Torre Pacheco offers equivalent quality at 35-45% lower cost basis.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca features Mediterranean climate with 300+ annual sunshine days, summer temperatures 28-35°C, and mild winters (12-18°C). Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring; winter freezing is virtually non-existent. This weather stability supports year-round holiday-let occupancy and outdoor lifestyle sustainability.

faqs.question: How far is Costa Blanca from UK?
